newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Bunds to meet barrier in 102.05 area.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Bunds to meet barrier in 102.05 area.

text.p: September Bund futures will meet strong resistance in the area around 102.00 on Friday and will head lower if it defeats them, technical analysts said.
"Bunds have reached their big barrier at 101.95 to 102.05 and I reckon they ought to sell off from there," said David Wood, an independant technical analsyt near London.
But he said if the contract could hold above 101.77 to 101.72 on Friday it would keep the pressure on those upper limits.
At 0654 GMT September Bund futures were at 101.92, up four basis points on the day.
The contract pushed up to test 101.95 on Thursday and has touched a high so far on Friday at 101.98.
Wood said a close above 102.05 for this session would be a bullish sign.
"We would have to think the contract has more steam in it, but I'm not really considering that at the moment," he said.

Technical analysts at a European bank in London said there was potential resistance in the 102.00 area, "although 102.50 looks more interesting -- the top of a small trend channel," they added in a note to clients.
They said Bunds needed to hold above 101.55/60 to maintain their positive stance.
To the downside Wood also set support in this region.
"It is all concentrated into an eight tick band between 101.62 to 101.54," he said. "It looks pretty good on hourly charts as we have been making lows there for the last three days."
He said a break below that region would confirm 101.95 to 102.05 as a significant barrier and open up the potential back to a big support level at 101.00.
"There is quite a battle going on in the longer term between 102.00 and 101.00," said Wood.
At the short end December Euromarks were at 96.76, up one basis point from Thursday's close.
